conversation_summary: Neon beach: hundreds brightly clothed Californians belly-flop into a current that ferries them seaward like parade floats. A kaleidoscope-dress girl presses a worn feminist book into your hands; later she’s stalked by a mirror-vendor hawking upskirt reflections of the ocean. Striped hotel staff, orange uniform flashing, takes the book and promises authorities. Surreal tide, recurrent girl, reflective predator, and the weight of a text bind the looping scene.
